Package api_b

Annotation Interface ExagonCommandHandler

@Target(METHOD) @Retention(RUNTIME) @Documented public @interface ExagonCommandHandler
An annotation to register a method that waits for the availability of subscribed events, as Exagon commands and Exagon notifications, to start processing. These events belong to the Exagon's Saga architecture, where an Exagon orchestrator dispatches an ExagonCommand that acts as trigger for the processing of a ExagonNotification set. When Exagon detects that every expected event from a single Saga flow is available, both Exagon command and Exagon notifications, this method is called by Exagon.

This annotation receives a class that is the expected command to trigger the processing, and its method should contain the expected notifications as arguments. The return value of this method should be either an object implementing a IExagonCommandResult or a IExagonCommandReply. This is an example: 


 @ExagonCommandHandler(FooCommand.class)
 public FooResult handleFooCommand(BarNotification bar) {
 	return new FooResult(); // instance of IExagonCommandResult
 }

A class that implements ExagonCommandHandler methods must be annotated with a ExagonController or a ExagonProtocolMapper, or else this methods will not be visible by Exagon.

Since:
5.0
See Also:
